data.name: CertificateNotTrustedErrorSummary
data.value: A connection was successfully established, but a trusted certificate is not installed on the computer running SQL Server.

data.name: CertificateNotTrustedGuidance
data.value: Please set up a trusted certificate on the server. Learn more Alternatively selecting the 'Trust server certificate' check box in the appliance configuration will connect to the server, however this may not be secure and therefore is not recommended.

data.name: CertificateNotTrustedPossibleCauses
data.value: A connection was successfully established, but a trusted certificate is not installed on the computer running SQL Server. Please set up a trusted certificate on the server

data.name: DatabaseMissingErrorSummary
data.value: Unable to find the specific database from this SQL Server instance.

data.name: DatabaseMissingGuidance
data.value: Please check if the selected server instance has this specific database. Assessment engine only assesses user databases.

data.name: DatabaseMissingPossibleCauses
data.value: Unable to find the specific database from the selected server instance.

data.name: UserDatabasesNotFoundErrorSummary
data.value: Unable to find any user databases that are associated with this SQL Server instance.

data.name: UserDatabasesNotFoundGuidance
data.value: Please check if the selected server instance has any user databases besides master, tempdb, msdb and model. Assessment engine only assesses user databases.

data.name: UserDatabasesNotFoundPossibleCauses
data.value: Unable to find any user databases from the selected server instance.

data.name: SqlConnectivityExceptionGuidance
data.value: SQL Server connection failed. Please use this interactive user guide to troubleshoot the connectivity issue.

data.name: InvalidServerErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - An error has occurred while establishing a connection to the server. When connecting to SQL Server, this failure may be caused by the fact that under the default settings SQL Server does not allow remote connections. (provider: Named Pipes Provider, error: 40 - Could not open a connection to SQL Server) (.Net SqlClient Data Provider)

data.name: InvalidServerGuidance
data.value: Not able to resolve the SQL Server name, this failure may be caused by the fact that under the default settings SQL Server does not allow remote connections. To check TCP/IP name resolution, you can use the ping command in the Windows operating system. If the error still persists, please contact Microsoft support. Learn more

data.name: InvalidServerPossibleCauses
data.value: The SQL Server client cannot connect to the server. This error could occur because either the client cannot resolve the name of the server or the name of the server is incorrect.

data.name: LoginFailed18452ErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - Login failed. The login is a SQL Server login and cannot be used with Windows Authentication.

data.name: LoginFailed18452Guidance
data.value: If you are trying to connect using SQL Server Authentication, verify that SQL Server is configured in Mixed Authentication Mode and SQL Server login exists. If you are trying to connect using Windows Authentication, verify that you are properly logged into the correct domain. Learn more

data.name: LoginFailed18452PossibleCauses
data.value: 1. The login may be a SQL Server login but the server only accepts Windows Authentication. 2. You are trying to connect using SQL Server Authentication but the login used does not exist on SQL Server. 3. The login may use Windows Authentication but the login is an unrecognized Windows principal. An unrecognized Windows principal means that the login cannot be verified by Windows. This could be because the Windows login is from an untrusted domain.

data.name: LoginFailed18456ErrorSummary
data.value: Invalid User name or Password provided.

data.name: LoginFailed18456Guidance
data.value: Please provide a credential with a valid Username and Password. Learn more

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses
data.value: The SQL Server client cannot connect to the server. This error could occur because of an authentication failure that involves a bad password or username.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State1
data.value: Error information isn't available. This state usually means you don't have permission to receive the error details. Contact your SQL Server administrator for more information.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State2
data.value: Invalid User name provided. Could not find a login matching the name provided.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State5
data.value: Invalid User name provided. The login does not exist in SQL Server, and the login attempt came from the local machine.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State6
data.value: An attempt was made to use a Windows login name with SQL Server Authentication.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State7
data.value: Login is disabled, and the password is incorrect.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State8
data.value: The password is incorrect.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State9
data.value: Password isn't valid. The password violated a password policy check.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State10
data.value: Password checking could not be performed because the login is disabled or locked on the domain controller.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State11
data.value: Login is valid, but server access failed. One possible cause of this error is when the Windows user has access to SQL Server as a member of the local administrators' group, but Windows isn't providing administrator credentials. To connect, start the connecting program using the Run as administrator option, and then add the Windows user to SQL Server as a specific login.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State12
data.value: Login is valid login, but server access failed. Token-based server access validation failed with an infrastructure error.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State13
data.value: SQL Server service is paused. No new connections can be accepted at this time.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State16
data.value: The default database was inaccessible. This could be because the database has been removed, renamed, or is offline.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State18
data.value: The error indicates that the user needs to change their password.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State23
data.value: Access to server validation failed while revalidating the login on the connection.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State27
data.value: It means that the database specified in the connection string has been removed, renamed, or is offline.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State28
data.value: It is caused due to overloaded connection pooling and connection resets.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State38
data.value: Couldn't find database requested by user.The database specified in the connection string is is no longer valid or online.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State40
data.value: Failed to open the connection to explicitly specified database.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State46
data.value: Failed to open connection to the database configured in the login object while revalidating the login on the connection.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State50
data.value: default collation for the login is incompatible with the collation of their default database.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State51
data.value: Failed to send an environment change notification to a log shipping partner node while revalidating the login.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State56
data.value: Failed attempted retry of token-based server access validation.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State58
data.value: It occurs when SQL Server is set to use Windows Authentication only, and a client attempts to log in using SQL authentication. Another cause is when SIDs don't match.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State62
data.value: It occurs when a Windows Authentication account tries to access a contained database, and the contained database exists, but the SIDs do not match.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State65
data.value: It ocuurs when contained user exists, the database is correct, but the password is invalid.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State102_111
data.value: It ocuurs due to Azure Active Directory login failures.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State122_124
data.value: Failure due to empty user name or password.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State126
data.value: It occurs because the database requested by user doesn't exist.

data.name: LoginFailed18456PossibleCauses_State132_133
data.value: It ocuurs due to Azure Active Directory login failures.

data.name: LoginFailed4064ErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - Login failed. Cannot open user default database.

data.name: LoginFailed4064Guidance
data.value: Use ALTER LOGIN to set the default database to master database. Grant CONNECT permission to the login. Learn more

data.name: LoginFailed4064PossibleCauses
data.value: The SQL Server login was unable to connect because of a problem with its default master database. Either the database itself is invalid or the login lacks CONNECT permission on the master database.

data.name: PasswordExpiredErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - Password for the provided credential has expired.

data.name: PasswordExpiredGuidance
data.value: The SQL Server login password may have expired, re-set the password and or extend the password expiration expiry date. Learn more

data.name: PasswordExpiredPossibleCauses
data.value: The password of the account has expired.

data.name: PasswordMustBeChangedErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - The password for the account the provided credential must be changed.

data.name: PasswordMustBeChangedGuidance
data.value: Change the password of the credential provided for SQL Server discovery. Learn more

data.name: PasswordMustBeChangedPossibleCauses
data.value: The password of the account must be changed.

data.name: PermissionErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - No permission to perform this action.

data.name: PermissionGuidance
data.value: Grant VIEW SERVER STATE permission to the SQL server user. Learn more

data.name: PermissionPossibleCauses
data.value: This error could occur because of lack of VIEW SERVER STATE permissions to login provided for SQL Server.

data.name: TimeoutExpiredErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - SQL Connection failed due to a timeout.

data.name: TimeoutExpiredGuidance
data.value: SQL Server timeout is expired. Make sure that you have configured the firewall on the server instance of SQL Server to accept connections. Learn more. If the error persists, please contact Microsoft support.

data.name: TimeoutExpiredPossibleCauses
data.value: The SQL Server client cannot connect to the server. This error could occur because the firewall on the server has refused the connection.

data.name: TLSConnectErrorGuidance
data.value: Enable connections using TLS 1.0 and 1.1 security protocol (Not recommended) at the appliance machine due to your legacy system still use the old TLS protocols. Or patch your sql server with latest patch. Otherwise, the legacy system will not be assessed. Learn more

data.name: TLSConnectErrorPossibleCauses
data.value: If user’s appliance environment enables TLS 1.2 only protocol, then it may cause issue to connect to the TLS1.0/1.1 environments. However, appliance’s image does not have enforce TLS1.2 only environment, hence this will NOT happen. If user downloads applianace and install manually, iti s possible that machine has TLS 1.2 only.

data.name: TLSConnectErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - A connection was successfully established with the server, but then an error occurred during the login process. (provider: SSL Provider, error: 0 - The client and server cannot communicate, because they do not possess a common algorithm.)

data.name: UnhandledSqlExceptionErrorSummary
data.value: Unhandled Sql exceptions occur.

data.name: UnhandledSqlExceptionGuidance
data.value: Please contact Microsoft if the issue persists.

data.name: InvalidConnection87Guidance
data.value: SQL Server connection failed. Please use this interactive user guide to troubleshoot the connectivity issue.

data.name: RemoteComputerRefusedNetworkConnectionErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - The remote computer refused the network connection.

data.name: RemoteComputerRefusedNetworkConnectionGuidance
data.value: Please check the SQL server TCP port configuration and retry the connection, or please follow the link here

data.name: RemoteComputerRefusedNetworkConnectionPossibleCauses
data.value: This error could occur when a process is trying to connect to a port which is not configured for listening.

data.name: WaitOperationTimedOutGuidance
data.value: Please check the network connectivity to the server and retry the connection, or please follow the link here

data.name: WaitOperationTimedOutPossibleCauses
data.value: This could be due to multiple network-related issues, e.g. network down, server stopped responding, etc.

data.name: WaitOperationTimeoutWin32ErrorSummary
data.value: Win32 wait timeout occur.

data.name: WaitOperationTimeoutWin32Guidance
data.value: Please follow the link here to troubleshoot this issue. Please contact Microsoft if the issue persists.

data.name: RemoteConnectionNotAllowedGuidance
data.value: To resolve this error, try one of the following actions: 1. Check the spelling of the SQL Server instance name that is specified in the connection string. 2. Use the SQL Server Configuration Manager tool to enable SQL Server to accept remote connections over the TCP or named pipes protocols. For more information about the accepting remote connections, see Enable or Disable a Server Network Protocol. 3. Make sure that you have configured the firewall on the server instance of SQL Server to open ports for SQL Server and the SQL Server Browser port (UDP 1434). 4. Make sure that the SQL Server Browser service is started on the server. Learn more

data.name: RemoteConnectionNotAllowedPossibleCauses
data.value: The SQL Server client cannot connect to the server. This error could be caused by one of the following reasons: 1. A specified SQL Server instance name is not valid. 2. The TCP, or named pipes protocols are not enabled. 3. The firewall on the server has refused the connection. 4. The SQL Server Browser service (sqlbrowser) is not started.

data.name: SQLAGDatabaseConnectivityGuidance
data.value: SQL Server connection failed. Please use this interactive user guide to troubleshoot the connectivity issue.

data.name: WindowsNTUserNotFoundErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - Windows NT user or group not found. Check the name again.

data.name: WindowsNTUserNotFoundGuidance
data.value: Please follow the link Learn more for possible causes and guidance to troubleshoot this issue. Please contact Microsoft if the issue persists.

data.name: ServerPrincipalAlreadyExistsErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - The server principal already exists. This means that the user login name is already mapped to a server login name.

data.name: ServerPrincipalAlreadyExistsGuidance
data.value: Please verify if the login name is mapped to SQL Server or not. Try dropping the login if it exists.

data.name: Permission15247ErrorSummary
data.value: Error {0} - User does not have permission to perform this action. This can happen when the user tries to create a new login or access a database without having the security admin or db_accessadmin roles.

data.name: Permission15247Guidance
data.value: Please try to provide db_admin roles to the user. Or try to use a high-privileged(sysadmin) login account.
